excerpt: From a glass of the strong stuff to Egyptian cotton bed sheets, these are the gifts you won’t want to return this Christmas. Still stuck for ideas? You’ll find plenty of inspiration here, whether you’re a tech head or self-professed sartorialist.
text: Men's Lifestyle We independently evaluate all recommended products and services. Any products or services put forward appear in no particular order. if you click on links we provide, we may receive compensation. FYI After a fresh round of research, we’ve confirmed that most of our original gift suggestions are still top-notch, with a few key updates. The Nomos Glashuette Tangente watch remains our favorite for its timeless style and craftsmanship, making it the perfect gift to treat yourself or someone special. However, Biotherms Aquapower Holiday Set has now moved to spot two, for its quality and overall value for starting a skincare routine. Whisky has now made it to the third spot, thanks to its ever-growing popularity and versatile appeal. We’ve also updated the high-fidelity headphones to reflect the latest model, ensuring you get the best sound quality available. Finally, we’ve swapped out the previous cellphone case recommendation to feature the most recent iPhone model, so you’re always covered with the latest tech accessories. Finally, we’ve added the Unbound Merino Beanie, a sustainable and luxuriously soft cold-weather essential, perfect for stylish warmth all winter long. November 2024 If you’ve not yet been accosted by Wham’s ‘Last Christmas’ either in the office or walking past the shops, you’ve definitely not got out enough. For ’tis the season, and with the multiplying tinsel comes growing anxieties over presents. In a world where shopping can happen at the click of a button, finding an answer to ‘what to ask for this Christmas’ or choosing a memorable gift for someone is harder said than done. But that’s enough about other people. As the festive season approaches, it’s the perfect time to ask yourself, “What do I want for Christmas?” Been eyeing up a new watch, or in need of a refill for your drinks cabinet? Take advantage of the Christmas spirit and have someone else shell out for one for you. If you’re wondering what to ask for for Christmas, this is your chance. That’s how it works, right? The Christmas spirit? With that in mind, we’ve collated things to ask for this Christmas, including the finest festive gifts for men at every price point. uncommongoods / Instagram What to Ask for Christmas This Year Wrist Bling It’s often thought that a watch is one of the few pieces of sparkly jewellery that men are allowed to actively seek out what they want when deciding what to ask for for Christmas. The problem? The generally hefty price tags that come attached to bling. Can’t afford a Swiss-made watch? That’s alright, you ain’t paying. Needed Skincare Upgrade Not taking care of your skin is so 2000 and late. Stop relying on faucet water to keep your skin looking clear and young, and instead ask for a beginner skincare set equipped with basic cleansers, moisturizers, and more. You will look refreshed and glowing in no time. Whisky For when you nail that job interview (slash whenever, really) – there is always an excuse for quality whisky. You can’t go wrong with these luxe options, and if you can’t splash out on a drink over Christmas, when can you? A New Cologne Just make sure to spell out exactly which aftershave you want, leave the empty bottle lying around, send links if you have to, or risk getting a fragrance that smells more like rubbing alcohol. These are all safe bets when you’re brainstorming what to ask for for Christmas gifts. Head Gear The trick to bossing the winter months as a style-conscious gentleman is to keep warm while looking good. Not as easy as it sounds – wearing a hat, of course, is an art form in itself – but you’ll manage it with any of this quality headgear. A Beard Trimmer Christmas is a fraught enough time as it is, don’t add giving your other half stubble rash. Keep your facial forest neat and tidy with a set of beard trimmers. Now all you have to do is worry about cleaning the hair-covered sink. Driving Gloves A pair of leather or faux leather gloves are an adulthood must. Either lined with cashmere or another luxurious fabric, these gloves will keep your hands warm and you looking cool. Perfect for long winter drives or on a first date in the bitter cold, definitely something to consider when thinking about what to ask for Christmas. A Nod To Hygge It’s hard to breathe fresh air into a market saturated by samey scents, but sometimes you’ve just got to go with the classics: applewood, forest leather and rose. Nothing says festive gifts for men more than a comfy candle and when they’re burned through, re-purpose the vessels as a key holder/coin purse/bud vase. This will also go over well as a white elephant gift at your office Christmas party, if you’re looking for inspiration. A Wallet Do you have your big-boy wallet yet? No? It’s time to upgrade. Whether you go with regular leather, faux leather, or vegan leather, you need a wallet that will stand the test of time – and actually has pockets for your cards, ID, and more. Trust us, no one wants to see you pull out a frayed and ratty wallet. Decadent Deodorant You shouldn’t rely solely on your months-old Old Spice to keep your BO in check. Instead, ensure you smell great always with a deodorant that will last. Also, updating your smells is never a bad thing. A Hat Upgrade  The Unbound Merino Beanie is the perfect blend of style and function for winter. Made from superfine, sustainably sourced Merino wool, it’s luxuriously soft, naturally insulating, and moisture-wicking to keep you warm without overheating. With a timeless rolled brim and ribbed design, it pairs effortlessly with any outfit while resisting odor and drying quickly for low-maintenance wear. Fancy Toothpaste No grooming routine is complete without the all-important clean mouth step – especially in those critical first few weeks of a new relationship. Make sure you’re also keeping your dentist happy this holiday season – the more the merrier, right? Adaptable Outdoor Gear Tropicfeel is a safe haven for worried buyers, as we all know gearheads can be some of the most nerve-wracking people to buy for. However, anyone with a love for outdoor garments will appreciate the tech and versatility of the NS40 Jacket. Made with 100% polyester these layers are waterproof, windproof, and extremely lightweight so they won’t take up much space in your pack. Ideal for the traveler and adventurer alike. A Razor Not all Razors are created equal but you can find some that are sharp in more ways than one. This year, make sure you ask for one that’s both useful and aesthetically pleasing as it’s likely the grooming gear that’s most in-use – and thus most-seen laying about. A Belt Odds are, you’re still using the same belt for every pair of your pants. Do yourself a favor and put new belts on your wish list. You need at least one brown belt and one black belt to avoid looking like a walking fashion faux pas. Travel Backpack Whether you’re hopping on flight after flight or just trying to make the most of your commute to work, a travel backpack for your laptop and other important necessities is, well, a necessity. And we aren’t talking about the backpack you brought to school every year. Time to get something professional, sleek, and stylish. Compact Heater Tired of waking up freezing? The air in your home too drafty? One way to solve these problems is by asking for a small portable heater. Without getting into a fight with your landlord, a small heater can not only save you from cold feet but also save you money. Stylish Luggage As the festive season arrives, finding that perfect Christmas gift can be a challenge. Enter the Horizn H5 Cabin Luggage – a traveler’s dream and definitely one of the things to ask for for Christmas if you’re on the go. This sleek, glossy suitcase isn’t only a feast for the eyes, it’s a gift of luxury. Its durable hard shell withstands the rigors of travel, while the smooth spinner wheels ensure a glide as effortless as a winter’s breeze. Inside, the smart compartments are a testament to organization, making packing more than just an afterthought. Looking for even more travel inspiration? Check out Horizns handy gift guide. Coffee Table Book Nothing says Christmas present like a giant slab of a book to fill out those shelves – the kind of luxury, oversized gift you can’t get enough of at Christmas. Packed with glossy pics and dense information, these are the dictionary definition of a man-book. Premium Cotton T-shirts If there’s one thing every man needs more of, it’s basics. Washed a red sock with your white T-shirt? Ruined. Coffee spill in transit? In the bin. Sweat stains? Out. We’d suggest requesting a pack of six or more. New Sneakers What is Christmas other than an opportunity to get a new pair of sneakers all bought and paid for? And we all know that unbeatable feeling of strutting around the house wearing a box fresh pair and brand new duds on Christmas Day. Try these classic designs or opt for a sleek new style from a brand like Oliver Cabell. Dress Socks Not just a myth; well-made dress socks make getting up when it’s still dark out that much easier (on your cold feet, at least). Wool-cotton styles wear better and keep your feet warmer. Add a splash of color under your suit trousers for a little added personality, or pick out a cheeky pair for a funny gift. Shades Sunglasses in winter might signal to others that you’re a bit of a tool. But getting this holiday expense out of the way early is a good way of keeping more cash in the kitty for when you’re eventually poolside. Until then, they can be used to ease the inevitable New Year’s hangover. Jewelry Male jewelry has really taken off over the past few years, with more men turning to necklaces, bracelets and earrings to add a personal touch to their style. If you want to get involved, be specific with what to ask for for Christmas – perhaps send over a couple of links so people know what styles you like. Big Boy Pants Underwear is a personal gift, sure, but also one that will never elicit an “ugh, more of those?” reaction. You may even discover a new favorite brand, like CDLP who has a sleek collection of upscale men’s underwear in every style you can think of. And really, do you actually need a reason for owning more pants? Adult Bed Sheets Crack a joke about being 27 going on 72 if you have to, but trust us, you’ll never look back. Aside from the fact no one is going to want to jump your bones if ‘where the magic happens’ is covered in race cars, there’s really no better excuse for snoozing through your morning meeting. Not only is this a gift for you, but doubles as a gift for your girlfriend, too. A Cosy AF Jacket Come on, own up. It’s cold. You can say it. This is a safe space. There’s nothing manly about tempting fate with frostbite on the walk back from the pub. So this year stock your wardrobe with a men’s jacket or super comfy layer that’s much warmer than a beer coat. House Slippers Don’t walk around on cold floors anymore. Instead, embrace the comfort that a sturdy pair of house mocassins or slippers can give you. Not only will it encourage you not to wear your outdoor shoes inside (and help keep your floors cleaner), but it will keep your toes warm when the colder months enter the chat. Comfy Joggers You can never have too much athleisure in your wardrobe. Perfect for running errands, working out, going on a casual stroll, resting at home, and even for more laid-back hangouts, a solid pair of joggers will keep you both comfy and stylish. Get pairs in different colors and fabrics, and you’ll be set. A Real Denim Upgrade Nowadays, you should own pieces of denim that don’t look like you bought them in high school. To upgrade your staple wardrobe you should definitely look into quality pieces of denim. Something like dark-wash raw denim can take you from the office to date night seamlessly (aka the gift that keeps on giving). What more could you want in a Christmas gift? Cellphone Case Have you updated your cellphone case yet? Do you even have a cellphone case? Treat yourself and protect your phone at the same time. Whether you want just some simple solid colors or a case with pockets for your cards or pictures, there is a case for you. A Soft Scarf Trust us, it’s not manly to have a cold neck. This Christmas, ask your loved ones for a super soft and warm scarf to help you get through the winter months. Also, it really pulls together a winter outfit. Knitwear A chunky fisherman’s jumper or merino wool roll neck is never a bad idea. Ideal for layering or just wearing around the house on a cold winter’s day, good quality knitwear should make up a large portion of your winter wardrobe, so why not add to it this Christmas? Fresh Pajamas It’s nice to spice up your nighttime wear with a bougie pajama set. Whether it’s satin or flannel, looking put together for bed adds maturity to your look. Also, it gets boring just wearing a T-shirt and boxers. A Towel Set On top of making sure you have big-boy sheets and bedding, you should also ensure that you have a big-boy towel set. When your hand towels match your body towel, you know you’ve truly made it in life – or are at least ready to fake it! Coffee The nectar of the gods. The fuel that keeps on giving. Whatever coffee is to you, asking for a few bags of your favorite coffee beans — or even a coffee subscription — will have you waking up energized (literally) on Christmas morning. It also doubles as the perfect last minute gift idea for anyone you may have forgotten. A Lamp To Love Still choosing between two extremes of lighting: pitch black and operating theatre? Switch your family on to sorting you out with a stylish lamp, and learn the art of hygge, candlelight, pillows and throws while you’re at it. You won’t regret it. An Alarm Clock Dark winter mornings make it even harder to crowbar yourself out from under the duvet. A wake-up light alarm clock mimics a real sunrise to coax your body into getting up and at ‘em while others are simply obnoxiously loud but get the job done. High-Fidelity Headphones Although you can get away with any old pair of earbuds, why would you? Invest in a high-quality pair and they will elevate your music to a whole new level of audio, proving useful long after you use them to drown out the in-laws over Christmas dinner. The Thinking Man’s Accessory Here’s a shocker: men have feelings too. Even if you don’t want to use a journal as a diary, they can help keep track of your thoughts and ideas; from money-making to incriminating. In either case, always burn once full. A Neck Massager Nowadays, life is just so stressful. From hunching over your computer for 8 hours a day (or more) to running around making sure your life doesn’t completely derail, you definitely need to relieve some tension. Ask for some bliss from the comfort of your own couch with a neck massager. Knife Set Whether your Gordon Ramsey or not, you need a grown-up knife set for chopping veggies, fruits, and more. You can’t rely on your blunt knives anymore; instead, know the satisfaction that comes with clean and crisp cuts. A Weighted Blanket Feeling anxious? Tap into the healing energy of a weighted blanket, and enjoy the benefits of having less stress and a better night’s sleep. It might take some getting used to but feeling the weight slowly pushing down on you will be worth it. A Legendary Air Fryer Chicken wings? Set. French fries? Set. Literally any food you can ask for? Check. Everyone made fun of air fryers at first, but you can become a culinary genius with this countertop gadget. Gameday will never be the same. A Portable Bluetooth Speaker From the shower to the beach, a portable speaker will allow you to narrate your life through song. Also, just think about the holiday cheer you can spread on Christmas morning by playing Christmas carols over the new speaker! Legit Bartender Kit Instead of going out every weekend and blowing through all your hard-earned money, have someone else invest in a bartender kit for you. Learn how to create your favorite cocktails from your kitchen, and become the speakeasy you were meant to be. Grilling Set There are millions of pans, pots and grilltops out there but to really up your BBQ game it’s best to start with the classics. You’ll never get those perfect grill marks if you’re still using the tiny fork from the utensil drawer. Embrace the wild outdoors (or at least the backyard) and make sure you never have another dry steak for those first-rate get-togethers. An Activity Tracker Looking to get fit in the new year? A fitness watch can be enough to motivate you (or shame you) into swapping the TV tray for the treadmill. Try not to take it as an insult, everyone is wearing them these days. Wall Art You’ve successfully moved out, you’ve kept a plant alive and you no longer live in halls of residence. Now it’s time to decorate the walls. No, not with boughs of holly. With tasteful wall prints (old lad’s mag pin-ups don’t count either.) A Good Cookbook It’s the 21st century and if you haven’t yet cooked a meal that consists of more than toast you’ve got some catching up to do. We’d suggest one-pot options to start (a home-cooked meal is still a home-cooked meal) while you work up to more complex recipes. An #InteriorGoals Throw There’s nothing manly about being cold. Or leaving your company to freeze while you sit there looking glib and oblivious in a Christmas jumper. Plus, it’s probably time you covered those sofa stains. Charging Station With all of our gadgets nowadays, you need a one-stop place to charge everything. When writing out your Christmas wish list, make sure to add a charging station. You will never have to worry you’re phone, iPad, etc is going to be dead before you can even use it. Watch Accessories This holiday season, elevate your gift receiving with the Pitaka Christmas Gift Box. Perfect for the tech-savvy and style-conscious, this box includes a Carbon Fiber Apple Watch Band and an Aramid Fiber Apple Watch Case, along with a unique refrigerator magnet. The watch band is adjustable, features a secure magnetic clasp, and is compatible with all Apple Watch models. Its lightweight, skin-friendly design ensures comfort and durability. The aramid fiber case is slim yet protective, seamlessly fitting Apple Watch straps. This limited-edition gift set is an excellent choice for those seeking a blend of style, function, and exclusivity this Christmas. Why Trust FashionBeans? At FashionBeans, we take the guesswork out of gift-giving by leveraging our expertise in style, trends, and product selection. Our editors have years of experience curating lists that blend practicality with flair, ensuring every gift hits the mark. We don’t just recommend products; we test, review, and evaluate them based on quality, craftsmanship, and user satisfaction. For this article, we handpicked items that not only align with the latest trends but also reflect long-lasting quality—perfect for the discerning individual. Whether it’s finding the right cologne or choosing stylish winter gear, our focus is on delivering well-rounded recommendations that balance affordability and luxury. We’ve researched each product to ensure that it meets our high standards for both form and function. Our team has cross-checked reviews, evaluated competing products, and curated only the best, so you don’t have to sift through endless options. Simply put, when it comes to holiday gifts, you can trust FashionBeans to deliver stylish, thoughtful recommendations that make both giving and receiving a breeze. FAQ Ah, the age-old dilemma—what are the best gifts this year? In 2024, it’s all about blending style with practicality. Sleek tech upgrades like portable Bluetooth speakers and smart alarm clocks are big winners, and who wouldn’t love a weighted blanket for those cozy winter nights? For the fashion-forward, premium cotton T-shirts or a chunky knit sweater are perfect for refreshing your wardrobe. And let’s not forget about the Nomos Glashuette Tangente watch for those who want to level up their wrist game. Basically, 2024 is about giving gifts that are not only stylish but also things people will actually use every day. You’ve graduated from asking for the latest toy (unless that toy happens to be a legendary air fryer, in which case, carry on). As an adult, it’s time to treat yourself to gifts that elevate your everyday life. Think high-fidelity headphones for tuning out the chaos, a luxury wallet to keep your essentials in check, or even a razor that doesn’t feel like you’re dragging a lawnmower across your face. And hey, if you’re all about self-care, ask for a neck massager—because adulting is stressful, and your back probably agrees. 50 Gift Ideas: Things To Ask for This Christmas 2024 SHARE ON We independently evaluate all recommended products and services. If you’ve not yet been accosted by Wham’s ‘Last Christmas’ either in the office or walking past the shops, you’ve definitely not got out enough. For ’tis the season, and with the multiplying tinsel comes growing anxieties over presents.

In a world where shopping can happen at the click of a button, finding an answer to ‘what to ask for this Christmas’ or choosing a memorable gift for someone is harder said than done. But that’s enough about other people. As the festive season approaches, it’s the perfect time to ask yourself, “What do I want for Christmas?”

Been eyeing up a new watch, or in need of a refill for your drinks cabinet? Take advantage of the Christmas spirit and have someone else shell out for one for you. If you’re wondering what to ask for for Christmas, this is your chance. That’s how it works, right? The Christmas spirit?

With that in mind, we’ve collated things to ask for this Christmas, including the finest festive gifts for men at every price point.

What to Ask for Christmas This Year

Wrist Bling

It’s often thought that a watch is one of the few pieces of sparkly jewellery that men are allowed to actively seek out what they want when deciding what to ask for for Christmas. The problem? The generally hefty price tags that come attached to bling. Can’t afford a Swiss-made watch? That’s alright, you ain’t paying.

Needed Skincare Upgrade

Not taking care of your skin is so 2000 and late. Stop relying on faucet water to keep your skin looking clear and young, and instead ask for a beginner skincare set equipped with basic cleansers, moisturizers, and more. You will look refreshed and glowing in no time.

Whisky

For when you nail that job interview (slash whenever, really) – there is always an excuse for quality whisky. You can’t go wrong with these luxe options, and if you can’t splash out on a drink over Christmas, when can you?

A New Cologne

Just make sure to spell out exactly which aftershave you want, leave the empty bottle lying around, send links if you have to, or risk getting a fragrance that smells more like rubbing alcohol. These are all safe bets when you’re brainstorming what to ask for for Christmas gifts.

Head Gear

The trick to bossing the winter months as a style-conscious gentleman is to keep warm while looking good. Not as easy as it sounds – wearing a hat, of course, is an art form in itself – but you’ll manage it with any of this quality headgear.

A Beard Trimmer

Christmas is a fraught enough time as it is, don’t add giving your other half stubble rash. Keep your facial forest neat and tidy with a set of beard trimmers. Now all you have to do is worry about cleaning the hair-covered sink.

Driving Gloves

A pair of leather or faux leather gloves are an adulthood must. Either lined with cashmere or another luxurious fabric, these gloves will keep your hands warm and you looking cool. Perfect for long winter drives or on a first date in the bitter cold, definitely something to consider when thinking about what to ask for Christmas.

A Nod To Hygge

It’s hard to breathe fresh air into a market saturated by samey scents, but sometimes you’ve just got to go with the classics: applewood, forest leather and rose.

Nothing says festive gifts for men more than a comfy candle and when they’re burned through, re-purpose the vessels as a key holder/coin purse/bud vase. This will also go over well as a white elephant gift at your office Christmas party, if you’re looking for inspiration.

A Wallet

Do you have your big-boy wallet yet? No? It’s time to upgrade. Whether you go with regular leather, faux leather, or vegan leather, you need a wallet that will stand the test of time – and actually has pockets for your cards, ID, and more. Trust us, no one wants to see you pull out a frayed and ratty wallet.

Decadent Deodorant

You shouldn’t rely solely on your months-old Old Spice to keep your BO in check. Instead, ensure you smell great always with a deodorant that will last. Also, updating your smells is never a bad thing.

A Hat Upgrade 

The Unbound Merino Beanie is the perfect blend of style and function for winter. Made from superfine, sustainably sourced Merino wool, it’s luxuriously soft, naturally insulating, and moisture-wicking to keep you warm without overheating. With a timeless rolled brim and ribbed design, it pairs effortlessly with any outfit while resisting odor and drying quickly for low-maintenance wear.

Fancy Toothpaste

No grooming routine is complete without the all-important clean mouth step – especially in those critical first few weeks of a new relationship. Make sure you’re also keeping your dentist happy this holiday season – the more the merrier, right?

Adaptable Outdoor Gear

Tropicfeel is a safe haven for worried buyers, as we all know gearheads can be some of the most nerve-wracking people to buy for. However, anyone with a love for outdoor garments will appreciate the tech and versatility of the NS40 Jacket.

Made with 100% polyester these layers are waterproof, windproof, and extremely lightweight so they won’t take up much space in your pack. Ideal for the traveler and adventurer alike.

A Razor

Not all Razors are created equal but you can find some that are sharp in more ways than one. This year, make sure you ask for one that’s both useful and aesthetically pleasing as it’s likely the grooming gear that’s most in-use – and thus most-seen laying about.

A Belt

Odds are, you’re still using the same belt for every pair of your pants. Do yourself a favor and put new belts on your wish list. You need at least one brown belt and one black belt to avoid looking like a walking fashion faux pas.

Travel Backpack

Whether you’re hopping on flight after flight or just trying to make the most of your commute to work, a travel backpack for your laptop and other important necessities is, well, a necessity. And we aren’t talking about the backpack you brought to school every year. Time to get something professional, sleek, and stylish.

Compact Heater

Tired of waking up freezing? The air in your home too drafty? One way to solve these problems is by asking for a small portable heater. Without getting into a fight with your landlord, a small heater can not only save you from cold feet but also save you money.

Stylish Luggage

As the festive season arrives, finding that perfect Christmas gift can be a challenge. Enter the Horizn H5 Cabin Luggage – a traveler’s dream and definitely one of the things to ask for for Christmas if you’re on the go. This sleek, glossy suitcase isn’t only a feast for the eyes, it’s a gift of luxury. Its durable hard shell withstands the rigors of travel, while the smooth spinner wheels ensure a glide as effortless as a winter’s breeze. Inside, the smart compartments are a testament to organization, making packing more than just an afterthought.

Looking for even more travel inspiration? Check out Horizns handy gift guide.

Coffee Table Book

Nothing says Christmas present like a giant slab of a book to fill out those shelves – the kind of luxury, oversized gift you can’t get enough of at Christmas. Packed with glossy pics and dense information, these are the dictionary definition of a man-book.

Premium Cotton T-shirts

If there’s one thing every man needs more of, it’s basics. Washed a red sock with your white T-shirt? Ruined. Coffee spill in transit? In the bin. Sweat stains? Out. We’d suggest requesting a pack of six or more.

Shades

If you want to get involved, be specific with what to ask for for Christmas – perhaps send over a couple of links so people know what styles you like.

Christmas is a fraught enough time as it is, don’t add giving your other half stubble rash. Keep your facial forest neat and tidy with a set of beard trimmers. Now all you have to do is worry about cleaning the hair-covered sink.

Driving Gloves

A pair of leather or faux leather gloves are an adulthood must. Either lined with cashmere or another luxurious fabric, these gloves will keep your hands warm and you looking cool. Perfect for long winter drives or on a first date in the bitter cold, definitely something to consider when thinking about what to ask for Christmas.

A Nod To Hygge

It’s hard to breathe fresh air into a market saturated by samey scents, but sometimes you’ve just got to go with the classics: applewood, forest leather and rose.

Nothing says festive gifts for men more than a comfy candle and when they’re burned through, re-purpose the vessels as a key holder/coin purse/bud vase. This will also go over well as a white elephant gift at your office Christmas party, if you’re looking for inspiration.

A Wallet

Do you have your big-boy wallet yet? No? It’s time to upgrade. Whether you go with regular leather, faux leather, or vegan leather, you need a wallet that will stand the test of time – and actually has pockets for your cards, ID, and more. Trust us, no one wants to see you pull out a frayed and ratty wallet.

Decadent Deodorant

You shouldn’t rely solely on your months-old Old Spice to keep your BO in check. Instead, ensure you smell great always with a deodorant that will last. Also, updating your smells is never a bad thing.

A Hat Upgrade 

The Unbound Merino Beanie is the perfect blend of style and function for winter. Made from superfine, sustainably sourced Merino wool, it’s luxuriously soft, naturally insulating, and moisture-wicking to keep you warm without overheating. With a timeless rolled brim and ribbed design, it pairs effortlessly with any outfit while resisting odor and drying quickly for low-maintenance wear.

Fancy Toothpaste

No grooming routine is complete without the all-important clean mouth step – especially in those critical first few weeks of a new relationship. Make sure you’re also keeping your dentist happy this holiday season – the more the merrier, right?

Adaptable Outdoor Gear

Tropicfeel is a safe haven for worried buyers, as we all know gearheads can be some of the most nerve-wracking people to buy for. However, anyone with a love for outdoor garments will appreciate the tech and versatility of the NS40 Jacket.

Made with 100% polyester these layers are waterproof, windproof, and extremely lightweight so they won’t take up much space in your pack. Ideal for the traveler and adventurer alike.

A Razor

Not all Razors are created equal but you can find some that are sharp in more ways than one. This year, make sure you ask for one that’s both useful and aesthetically pleasing as it’s likely the grooming gear that’s most in-use – and thus most-seen laying about.

A Belt

Odds are, you’re still using the same belt for every pair of your pants. Do yourself a favor and put new belts on your wish list. You need at least one brown belt and one black belt to avoid looking like a walking fashion faux pas.

Travel Backpack

Whether you’re hopping on flight after flight or just trying to make the most of your commute to work, a travel backpack for your laptop and other important necessities is, well, a necessity. And we aren’t talking about the backpack you brought to school every year. Time to get something professional, sleek, and stylish.

Compact Heater

Tired of waking up freezing? The air in your home too drafty? One way to solve these problems is by asking for a small portable heater. Without getting into a fight with your landlord, a small heater can not only save you from cold feet but also save you money.

Stylish Luggage

As the festive season arrives, finding that perfect Christmas gift can be a challenge. Enter the Horizn H5 Cabin Luggage – a traveler’s dream and definitely one of the things to ask for for Christmas if you’re on the go. This sleek, glossy suitcase isn’t only a feast for the eyes, it’s a gift of luxury. Its durable hard shell withstands the rigors of travel, while the smooth spinner wheels ensure a glide as effortless as a winter’s breeze. Inside, the smart compartments are a testament to organization, making packing more than just an afterthought.

Looking for even more travel inspiration? Check out Horizns handy gift guide.

Coffee Table Book

Nothing says Christmas present like a giant slab of a book to fill out those shelves – the kind of luxury, oversized gift you can’t get enough of at Christmas. Packed with glossy pics and dense information, these are the dictionary definition of a man-book.

Premium Cotton T-shirts

If there’s one thing every man needs more of, it’s basics. Washed a red sock with your white T-shirt? Ruined. Coffee spill in transit? In the bin. Sweat stains? Out. We’d suggest requesting a pack of six or more.

New Sneakers

What is Christmas other than an opportunity to get a new pair of sneakers all bought and paid for? And we all know that unbeatable feeling of strutting around the house wearing a box fresh pair and brand new duds on Christmas Day. Try these classic designs or opt for a sleek new style from a brand like Oliver Cabell.

Dress Socks

Not just a myth; well-made dress socks make getting up when it’s still dark out that much easier (on your cold feet, at least). Wool-cotton styles wear better and keep your feet warmer. Add a splash of color under your suit trousers for a little added personality, or pick out a cheeky pair for a funny gift.

Shades

Sunglasses in winter might signal to others that you’re a bit of a tool. But getting this holiday expense out of the way early is a good way of keeping more cash in the kitty for when you’re eventually poolside. Until then, they can be used to ease the inevitable New Year’s hangover.

Jewelry

Male jewelry has really taken off over the past few years, with more men turning to necklaces, bracelets and earrings to add a personal touch to their style. If you want to get involved, be specific with what to ask for for Christmas – perhaps send over a couple of links so people know what styles you like.

Big Boy Pants

Underwear is a personal gift, sure, but also one that will never elicit an “ugh, more of those?” reaction. You may even discover a new favorite brand, like CDLP who has a sleek collection of upscale men’s underwear in every style you can think of. And really, do you actually need a reason for owning more pants?

Adult Bed Sheets

Crack a joke about being 27 going on 72 if you have to, but trust us, you’ll never look back. Aside from the fact no one is going to want to jump your bones if ‘where the magic happens’ is covered in race cars, there’s really no better excuse for snoozing through your morning meeting. Not only is this a gift for you, but doubles as a gift for your girlfriend, too.

A Cosy AF Jacket

Come on, own up. It’s cold. You can say it. This is a safe space. There’s nothing manly about tempting fate with frostbite on the walk back from the pub. So this year stock your wardrobe with a men’s jacket or super comfy layer that’s much warmer than a beer coat.

House Slippers

Don’t walk around on cold floors anymore. Instead, embrace the comfort that a sturdy pair of house mocassins or slippers can give you.

Not only will it encourage you not to wear your outdoor shoes inside (and help keep your floors cleaner), but it will keep your toes warm when the colder months enter the chat.

Comfy Joggers

You can never have too much athleisure in your wardrobe. Perfect for running errands, working out, going on a casual stroll, resting at home, and even for more laid-back hangouts, a solid pair of joggers will keep you both comfy and stylish. Get pairs in different colors and fabrics, and you’ll be set.

A Real Denim Upgrade

Nowadays, you should own pieces of denim that don’t look like you bought them in high school. To upgrade your staple wardrobe you should definitely look into quality pieces of denim.

Something like dark-wash raw denim can take you from the office to date night seamlessly (aka the gift that keeps on giving). What more could you want in a Christmas gift?

Cellphone Case

Have you updated your cellphone case yet? Do you even have a cellphone case? Treat yourself and protect your phone at the same time. Whether you want just some simple solid colors or a case with pockets for your cards or pictures, there is a case for you.

A Soft Scarf

Trust us, it’s not manly to have a cold neck. This Christmas, ask your loved ones for a super soft and warm scarf to help you get through the winter months. Also, it really pulls together a winter outfit.

Knitwear

A chunky fisherman’s jumper or merino wool roll neck is never a bad idea. Ideal for layering or just wearing around the house on a cold winter’s day, good quality knitwear should make up a large portion of your winter wardrobe, so why not add to it this Christmas?

Fresh Pajamas

It’s nice to spice up your nighttime wear with a bougie pajama set. Whether it’s satin or flannel, looking put together for bed adds maturity to your look. Also, it gets boring just wearing a T-shirt and boxers.

A Towel Set

On top of making sure you have big-boy sheets and bedding, you should also ensure that you have a big-boy towel set. When your hand towels match your body towel, you know you’ve truly made it in life – or are at least ready to fake it!

Coffee

The nectar of the gods. The fuel that keeps on giving. Whatever coffee is to you, asking for a few bags of your favorite coffee beans — or even a coffee subscription — will have you waking up energized (literally) on Christmas morning. It also doubles as the perfect last minute gift idea for anyone you may have forgotten.

A Lamp To Love

Still choosing between two extremes of lighting: pitch black and operating theatre? Switch your family on to sorting you out with a stylish lamp, and learn the art of hygge, candlelight, pillows and throws while you’re at it. You won’t regret it.

An Alarm Clock

Dark winter mornings make it even harder to crowbar yourself out from under the duvet. A wake-up light alarm clock mimics a real sunrise to coax your body into getting up and at ‘em while others are simply obnoxiously loud but get the job done.

High-Fidelity Headphones

Although you can get away with any old pair of earbuds, why would you? Invest in a high-quality pair and they will elevate your music to a whole new level of audio, proving useful long after you use them to drown out the in-laws over Christmas dinner.

The Thinking Man’s Accessory

Here’s a shocker: men have feelings too. Even if you don’t want to use a journal as a diary, they can help keep track of your thoughts and ideas; from money-making to incriminating. In either case, always burn once full.

A Neck Massager

Nowadays, life is just so stressful. From hunching over your computer for 8 hours a day (or more) to running around making sure your life doesn’t completely derail, you definitely need to relieve some tension. Ask for some bliss from the comfort of your own couch with a neck massager.

Knife Set

Whether your Gordon Ramsey or not, you need a grown-up knife set for chopping veggies, fruits, and more. You can’t rely on your blunt knives anymore; instead, know the satisfaction that comes with clean and crisp cuts.

A Weighted Blanket

Feeling anxious? Tap into the healing energy of a weighted blanket, and enjoy the benefits of having less stress and a better night’s sleep. It might take some getting used to but feeling the weight slowly pushing down on you will be worth it.

A Legendary Air Fryer

Chicken wings? Set. French fries? Set. Literally any food you can ask for? Check. Everyone made fun of air fryers at first, but you can become a culinary genius with this countertop gadget. Gameday will never be the same.

A Portable Bluetooth Speaker

From the shower to the beach, a portable speaker will allow you to narrate your life through song. Also, just think about the holiday cheer you can spread on Christmas morning by playing Christmas carols over the new speaker!

Legit Bartender Kit

Instead of going out every weekend and blowing through all your hard-earned money, have someone else invest in a bartender kit for you. Learn how to create your favorite cocktails from your kitchen, and become the speakeasy you were meant to be.

Grilling Set

There are millions of pans, pots and grilltops out there but to really up your BBQ game it’s best to start with the classics. You’ll never get those perfect grill marks if you’re still using the tiny fork from the utensil drawer.

Embrace the wild outdoors (or at least the backyard) and make sure you never have another dry steak for those first-rate get-togethers.

An Activity Tracker

Looking to get fit in the new year? A fitness watch can be enough to motivate you (or shame you) into swapping the TV tray for the treadmill. Try not to take it as an insult, everyone is wearing them these days.

Wall Art

You’ve successfully moved out, you’ve kept a plant alive and you no longer live in halls of residence. Now it’s time to decorate the walls. No, not with boughs of holly. With tasteful wall prints (old lad’s mag pin-ups don’t count either.)

A Good Cookbook

It’s the 21st century and if you haven’t yet cooked a meal that consists of more than toast you’ve got some catching up to do. We’d suggest one-pot options to start (a home-cooked meal is still a home-cooked meal) while you work up to more complex recipes.

An #InteriorGoals Throw

There’s nothing manly about being cold. Or leaving your company to freeze while you sit there looking glib and oblivious in a Christmas jumper. Plus, it’s probably time you covered those sofa stains.

Charging Station

With all of our gadgets nowadays, you need a one-stop place to charge everything. When writing out your Christmas wish list, make sure to add a charging station. You will never have to worry you’re phone, iPad, etc is going to be dead before you can even use it.
